docblock.description: The controller object.
docblock.long-description: Contains a reference to the module controller.

docblock.description: Stores controller reference.
docblock.long-description: Passes a reference of the module controller to this object.

docblock.description: Registers an event type.
docblock.long-description: Registers an event type to be used by the engine identified by a name specified in the first argument. The event type can then be used to explicity fire events of that type using the method 'fireEvent'. The event type must be assigned a category when registering as the second argument. A short description of the event may be provided.

docblock.description: Unregisters an event type.
docblock.long-description:
Removes an event type from the system. This is specified by the event name which is the only argument accepted by the method.

$reg->unregisterEvent('event_name');

docblock.description: Fetches event types by category.
docblock.long-description:
Fetches the names of all event types of a specified category.

$names=$reg->fetchEventNames('category');

docblock.description: Fetches event categories.
docblock.long-description:
Fetches the names of all categories of events registered on the system.

$cats=$reg->fetchEventCategories();

docblock.description: This file contains the Event class.
docblock.long-description:
PHP version 5.3

LICENSE: This file is part of Frisby. Frisby is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. Frisby is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with Frisby. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/.

docblock.description: An instance of this class is used to manage events explicitly.
docblock.long-description:
require_once('Event.php');

$event=new Event();

tag.name: license
tag.description: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt The GNU General Public License

docblock.description: The controller object.
docblock.long-description: Contains a reference to the module controller.

docblock.description: Stores controller reference.
docblock.long-description: Passes a reference of the module controller to this object.

docblock.description: Fires an event explicitly.
docblock.long-description: The method accepts the name of the event as the first argument. The second is the source identifier and should be a valid user account ID. The third is the destination identifier and is optional. The method fires an event specified by the event name and logs it. The event name must be a registered event name. This engine comes with a set of registered events, which can be viewed by using the 'fetchEventNames' and 'fetchEventCategories' methods. Additional events may be registered by using the 'registerEvent' method.

docblock.description: Updates an event status.
docblock.long-description:
The method accepts an array of event IDs and a status value. It sets the status of the logged events specified by the IDs to the status value.

$events=array(1,4,3,7);
$event->updateStatus($events,1);

docblock.description: Fetches logged events of a specific category.
docblock.long-description:
Event categories include profile,groups,etc. The method accepts the category name and a timestamp value in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format. A status can be optionally specified as an argument to filter by the status of the events. The method fetches all events of the specified category logged since the specified timestamp.

$eventset=$event->fetchEventsByCategory('profile','2012-12-01 00:00:00');

docblock.description: Fetches logged events related to a particular entity.
docblock.long-description:
The entity referred to here may be a group or user or any other defined entity. The method accepts the IDs of the corresponding source and/or targets of the events, corresponding to the entities. A timestamp is also accepted as a parameter to fetch event logs since a particular time. Timestamp follows the 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format.

$eventset=$event->fetchEventsByEntity(1,2,'2012-12-01 00:00:00');

docblock.description: This file contains the super-class for all controllers.
docblock.long-description:
PHP version 5.3

docblock.description: An instance of this class represents a generic controller super-class which any controller class may extend.
docblock.long-description:
require_once('Controller.php');

class Sample extends Controller {
     function __construct() {
         $this->assoc['methodname']='ClassName';
         $this->loc['ClassName']='ClassFile.php';
     }
}

tag.name: license
tag.description: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt The GNU General Public License

docblock.description: A registry for the class methods.
docblock.long-description: Contains the mappings of the method names to the respective class names.

docblock.description: A registry for the class locations.
docblock.long-description: Contains the mappings of the class names to the respective class files.

docblock.description: Class loader for a module.
docblock.long-description:
Loads a sub-module class and returns an object of the sub-module class. The argument accepted is that of a method name which is registered with the current module.

$mod=$obj->loadSubModule('method_name');

docblock.description: Method dispatcher for the controller.
docblock.long-description:
Invokes a method of the current module. Accepts two arguments: the method name and an array containing the argument list of the function to be called. The value returned consists of an array of two objects: a boolean flag representing success or failure and, the data returned by the invoked method.

$args=array($arg1,...);
$resultset=$obj->invoke('method_name',$args);

docblock.description: The setup object.
docblock.long-description: Contains an object of the Setup class.

docblock.description: The dispatcher object.
docblock.long-description: Contains an object of the Dispatcher class.

docblock.description: A registry for the setup methods.
docblock.long-description: Contains the mappings from the external setup method names to the internal setup methods.

docblock.description: Loads and initializes the classes required by the engine.
docblock.long-description: This is a constructor for the Frisby class object. It loads the dispatcher and the setup and initializes them.

docblock.description: The master method to execute the social functions.
docblock.long-description:
This is the method that should be used to execute the functions advertised by the engine (Use the 'reg_getMethodNames' function to fetch the list of supported functions). The function accepts the method name as the first argument, followed by a variable number of arguments which are specific to the method specified. Please refer to the module functions regarding the arguments accepted by the functions.

$resultset=$frisby->call('method_name',$arg1,...);

docblock.description: An instance of this class represents a Database helper to manage database operations.
docblock.long-description:
require_once('Database.php');

Database::connect();

tag.name: license
tag.description: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt The GNU General Public License

docblock.description: The database connection object.
docblock.long-description: Contains the database handler returned by the mysql_connect() method.

docblock.description: The database prefix.
docblock.long-description: The prefix used for all tables in the database. This prefix is automatically prepended to the names of tables and views before querying on the database.

docblock.description: Connects to the database.
docblock.long-description:
Connects to the database server and selects the specified database. The credentials used here i.e. hostname,username,password are read from the configuration file 'database.inc'. This file needs to be configured before the software runs properly.

Database::connect();

docblock.description: Disconnects from the database.
docblock.long-description:
Disconnects from the database server and releases the handler.

Database::disconnect();

docblock.description: Fetches data from the database.
docblock.long-description:
The method accepts a table name as the first argument followed by a string of comma separated column names and a criterion string to be supplied to the 'WHERE' clause of the SQL query. Data is returned in the form of a linear array of associative arrays. Each element of the linear array represents a row fetched by the query on the database. Each associative array represents a set of values for a particular row. The keys of these arrays are the field names and the values, their corresponding values.

$resultset=Database::get('table_name','column_names','criterion');

docblock.description: Inserts data into the database.
docblock.long-description:
The method accepts a table name as the first argument. The second argument should be a string array containing the field names. The third argument should also be a string array containing the values of the fields. Note that the indices of the fields in the first array and the their respective values in the second array should coincide. The method returns the value returned by the mysql_query() function.

$cols=array('col_1','col_2');
$vals=array('val_1','val_2');
Database::add('table_name',$cols,$vals);

docblock.description: Updates data in the database.
docblock.long-description:
The method accepts a table name followed by two string arrays containing the field names and their corresponding values, and a criterion string. The criterion string is directly used in the 'WHERE' clause of the query. The method returns the value returned by the mysql_query() method.

$cols=array('col_1','col_2');
$vals=array('val_1','val_2');
Database::update('table_name',$cols,$vals,'criterion');

docblock.description: Deletes data from the database.
docblock.long-description:
The method accepts a table name and a criterion string based on which it will perform deletions. The return value is that returned by the mysql_query() method.

Database::remove('table_name','criterion');

docblock.description: Executes a user-specified query on the database.
docblock.long-description:
This method accepts a raw query and executes it on the database. However since the method is unaware of the type of data returned by the database server, it returns a handler for the processed query. The handler can be used to fetch rows from the database using the mysql_fetch_array() or mysql_fetch_assoc() methods.

$link=Database::query();
$rows=array();
while($row=mysql_fetch_assoc($link)) array_push($rows,$row);

docblock.description: Fetches the database prefix.
docblock.long-description:
Fetches the prefix defined in the configuration file for the database schema.

$pre=Database::getPrefix();
